        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> readSmallTextFile(java.lang.String aFileName)
                                                          throws java.io.IOException
        Note: the javadoc of Files.readAllLines says it's intended for small files. But its implementation uses buffering, so it's likely good even for fairly large files.

        java.io.IOException

      • processLine

        protected void processLine(java.lang.String aLine)
        Overridable method for processing lines in different ways.

        This simple default implementation expects simple name-value pairs, separated by an '=' sign. Examples of valid input: height = 167cm mass = 65kg disposition = "grumpy" this is the name = this is the value

      • getContents

        public static java.lang.String getContents(java.io.File aFile)
        Fetch the entire contents of a text file, and return it in a String. This style of implementation does not throw Exceptions to the caller.
        Parameters:
        aFile - is a file which already exists and can be read.

      • convertUTF8ToUnicodeEscape

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> convertUTF8ToUnicodeEscape(java.io.File UTF8)
                                                                   throws java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException,
                                                                          java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                                                          java.io.IOException
        Reads file in UTF-8 encoding and output to STDOUT in ASCII with unicode escaped sequence for characters outside of ASCII. It is equivalent to: native2ascii -encoding utf-8
        Parameters:
        UTF8 -
        Returns:
        ASCII
        Throws:
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        java.io.IOException

      • convertUnicodeEscapeToUTF8

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> convertUnicodeEscapeToUTF8(java.io.File ASCII)
                                                                   throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                                                          java.io.IOException
        Reads file with unicode escaped characters and write them out to stdout in UTF-8 This utility is equivalent to: native2ascii -reverse -encoding utf-8
        Parameters:
        ASCII -
        Returns:
        UTF8
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        java.io.IOException
